caption: An amazing insight into the fashion icon and well worth the visit! Im not massively into fashion (my wife and daughters are) and so went in as a ‚Äúpassenger‚Äù with an open mind and actually loved it! Soo many interesting stories captured here, and a real view into his life and art form. I‚Äôd go back again next time I was in Paris.

One of the prettiest museums in Paris. Not too big, not too small, it offers a great insight into the history of the brand. Moreover, they do temporary exhibitions to showcase more of the pieces. Right now, they have ‚ÄúThe Flowers of Yves Saint Laurent‚Äù, a stunning collection that should definitely be checked out! I recommend buying tickets online to avoid any potential queues.

The only fashion museum I  wanted to see  before coming to Paris. He was the first designer to have a ready to wear collection.  My first perfume I can remember was Rive Gouache  and that fragrance is still prevalent today. He was a true iconoclast.   His designs are as fresh and vibrant today, as they were in the 70, 90 and 90s. He was about making woman fell feminine and powerful in their own right. This museum presents the space that his creative genius was prevalent. This is a bit off th e beaten path bur well enough the walk down the river walk to get there.

I had a great time! I had seen an exhibit that came through the USA seven years ago and they had a lot more of his designs on display.  I was hoping to see a lot more here but they can‚Äôt show everything! I went during the flower exhibit and it was nice ! It was a cool experience seeing his work space and all. I would go again for another exhibit.  ** buy tickets in advance!**

It‚Äôs a been a good experience however I would expect a little more from this exhibition. I really liked the movie and to be in his cabinet - this was very impressive for me. I would be happy to see more dresses from other collections, and to get to know about his life.

I visited here recently after wanting to visit it for a long time. I had visited the La Galerie Dior a few weeks ago and was so impressed by that and so I found this musee very dull and boring in comparison. The clothes were presented in a very bland and boring way when you compare to the Dior mus√©e. I was in and out in under 30 minutes. There are some interesting pieces but for me, it was just bland and I absolutely love this sort of things.

I purchased a free ticket for unemployed people. On the website it says everyone in possession of an unemployed card can have access to it but that's untrue. At the door a rude guy refused to take me it saying only for unemployed French people. It doesn't have any sense it is in English and does not accept foreigners with those documents... I feel it's a kind of fraud as you have to pay once in there. It is not very costly but sadly not worth it. I don't recommend the visit as there is only few dresses not the most representatives from YSL... go to Dior or D&G they really worth the price and my recommendation to YSL museum change the information on your site to not misslead people... if only French people can have access to free tickets don't put that in English to confuse people. The only dresses are the ones on the photos attached ...as I said,not worth it. Also all the dresses you see that people saw previous years are not longer available.

This is a wonderful museum to visit for anyone who is interested in fashion and haute coutoure. Being able to see the beautiful clothes designed by YSL les fleurs   was exceptional and viewing all the hard work and intricate detailing applied to each piece was truly appreciated.
We saw as well short movie of 9 min - excelente. It is worth to see. Price of the books in bookstore- excelente. He was really a genius.

A very disappointing museum. Barely any pieces to view, and the floral exhibition was underwhelming. Tiny and uninteresting, you learn very little about the magnificent talent and story of his rise. The most interesting part is the reenactment of his studio, which is great. Not worth the price.

I expected a lot more. It's a small "museum" with very few things to see. If you expect to admire the art of YSL, then you are in the wrong place. All the dresses are in the museum of Marocco(I've been there and was really amazing!!!). The stuff was very friendly and there's an elevator.

Its an OK place but when you saw before the Dior Exhibition in Paris or Armani in Milan then this is sadly not too crazy. Our feeling was that the entire exhibition is very small. Even there are a few beautiful pieces but we were expecting to see much more from YSL. So for us was it a bit disappointing. Ah and its super super cold inside because of the AC. In summer better bring a jacket.
It‚Äôs nice, I like the vibes, and it really immerses you in Yves‚Äô life. I do like it, but in my opinion, there‚Äôs something missing. I had higher expectations.
great experience especially that you can see his atelier on the ‚Äò last ‚Äò floor of the exhibition, had a great time!

Mus√©e Yves Saint Laurent is a beautiful museum in honor of the fashion designer we all respect and admire. I myself am a big fan of YSL and I was visiting Paris and this was on my list of things I wanted to do in addition to other fashion boutiques and museums. It was a very nice place, had multiple languages in the walls so you could understand if you didn‚Äôt speak French, had a room where you could watch this documentary about him with English subtitles at the bottom, a room with different sketches and fabrics he had, and of course rooms with preserved pieces by him from various lines. If you want to be a fashion designer, come here. It will give you lots of inspiration for your next sketch ü©∑
I feel like it could have been more especially with the languages they offered the videos in. However very educational and my family enjoyed. But tickets in advance!!!
The Flowers of Yves Saint Laurent exposition, beautiful gowns and jewelry. Cute giftshop!

One of the most inspiring highlights of my trip to Paris! I went on a Saturday afternoon and waited only 5 minutes in line with a ticket. Luckily, there was no rush, as I can‚Äôt stand waiting in line for hours (which is why I didn‚Äôt go to the Dior museum). A really interesting and colorful exhibition. The short film/documentary inside was brief but fascinating, and I watched it twice. Books and cards were available in the shop as souvenirs. The staff was kind. I warmly recommend it!
I become so emotional and why overwhelmed by the story. Simply beautiful.
Such a great and inspiring visit. Very much enjoyed my time inside

Kering:   For god‚Äôs sake to spend some money and let them improve one of your flagship brand museums.   Honestly disappointed.  Collection curation was weak compared to other traveling museum shows.   Needs a new paint job.   Better lighting.  I whipped through in 30.    I mean, Dior exhibits look like a commercial so I‚Äôm glad it wasn‚Äôt that but come on‚Ä¶.   The chance to see the YSL studio space was pretty awesome.  Reminded me of the Brancusi studio at Pompidou.   But don‚Äôt bother w this one unless they radically change what‚Äôs happening here if if you‚Äôre in the area, esp if you‚Äôve seen other YSL exhibits.

The Mus√©e Yves Saint Laurent was inaugurated in 2017 and describes in 2 rooms to the left of the main entrance the work, life and legacy of the French designer. It is housed in the Fondation Pierre Berg√©-Yves Saint Laurent, in the former location of the haute couture workshop ‚ÄúYSL‚Äù. When we visited the museum on March 2024, there was a temporary exhibition of Yves Saint Laurent transparencies, with lots of clothes where you can realize how pioneering designer he was. The exhibition was very interesting and not at all tiring even for those of us who do not have much knowledge about the fashion field.

Very beautiful and well put together. The only reason I am deducting one star is cause it was very small. I was done in about 30min :( also I would like to see more options at the gift shop. Maybe a nice silk scarf with YSL prints or cups etc
Loved this exhibit. It isn't crazy busy, but there is so much to see. Make sure you book a ticket online so you don't wait in line!
The museum is quite small. Nice information, but limited display.
It‚Äôs small but I really liked it. Especially seeing Yves‚Äôs studio. Would have liked to have seen more dresses, though.

For me in this museum was inspiring his room, where he worked. Tables, full of beautiful things, bookshelves with a lot of books, so you can understand where YSL took inspiration. Museum not big by itself.  Tickets you can get right there. Small souvenir shop there, with beautiful postcards, books...

Nice museum, not big but impressive to walk around a place where Yves Saint Laurent worked for such a long time. Staff at the entrance could be a little bit more friendly. Open and close the door for visitors for example especially when it is raining the whole day.

I've always been a fan of this brand so i finally visited their museum in Paris. Love the displays and the presentation of facts & history of YSL. It gaves me knowledge of how it all started to become one of the top luxury brands nowadays. If you are a YSL fan or just a fashionista? You'll find this place inspirational in reaching your fashion dreams:-)

Pretty collection, but compared to other fashion museum collections I've been to (Kunstmuseum Den Haag, Kunstgewerbemuseum Berlin) it is quite small and underwhelming. Worth going if you're in the area and don't have to wait, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.
Well kept secret. If you like fashion and design, it's the place to go. The highlight of this museum for me is where Yves St-Laurent was designing the clothing, for me it was the clue of this visit.

For all the fashion enthusiasts out there. This place gives you the perfect opportunity to understand the life of YSL. The symmetry is asymmetrical display is very well captured. His movements of making fashion more available and accessible are very impressive.  And most I loved was his love for symmetry and symbolically the museum is designed in a very similar maze shape. The only thing i felt was that it could have been a little more interactive. But thats me guys

When we visited, there was the Gold collection on exhibition. It was amazing. A must see if you have extra time in Paris. You can learn about his line of work and his amazing devotions to the world of fashion.

If you are in Paris, be sure to visit! This is for lovers of high fashion and fans of the great French fashion designer Yves Saint Laurent. It was there that his haute couture house was located, in a beautiful building in the architectural style of the Second Empire. The house was installed on the site in 1974 after Saint Laurent broke into the world of haute couture, and the museum opened to the public in October 2017.

Visited the Gold exhibition. Because I saw the grand retrospective some 15 years ago in the Grand Palais I expected a larger display of YSL's creations, but the exhibition was rather small. Anyway, it was worth visiting this iconic atelier building, where a large part of his creations in 50 years of work were conceived.

It's an intriguing place to explore in Paris, offering a unique perspective on the company's development. However, it's not really geared toward the general public; to fully appreciate it, you need to be well-versed in the world of fashion. Otherwise, it might feel a bit empty and unengaging.

One of my absolute favourite things I did while in Paris is a trip to the yves Saint Laurent Museum, the spectacular museum houses a variety of collections from the designer, Rooms filled with information about his life, quotes audio and visuals as well as a very intimate look into his work office. If in Paris, this is one thing, I would definitely recommend doing. even though I‚Äôve been before I will definitely go again and again and again easily one of my favourite designers. this museum represents his life, Legacy and designs so very well

Excellent museum that pays homage to YSL and the brand. Fashion is art, history and pop culture wrapped in one and this museum gives you that wrap around experience. I very much enjoyed my time here, especially the recreation of his studio.
